meanings.sent1: The illuded man believed the fake treasure map was real.
meanings.sent2: She felt illuded by the magician's clever trick.
meanings.sent3: The illuded cat chased its own tail, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The illuded customer thought the product would solve all their problems.
meanings.sent5: The illuded student thought the internet rumor was true.

meanings.sent1: The illuded audience clapped for the disappearing act.
meanings.sent2: He was illuded by the promise of easy money.
meanings.sent3: The illuded squirrel tried to hide its acorn in an empty tree.
meanings.sent4: The illuded traveler followed the wrong signs and got lost.
meanings.sent5: The illuded child believed the toy was alive.

meanings.definition: deluded or misled by false beliefs
meanings.sent1: The illuded cult members followed their leader blindly.
meanings.sent2: She was illuded into thinking the world was ending.
meanings.sent3: The illuded patient refused treatment due to false information.
meanings.sent4: The illuded politician promised impossible changes.
meanings.sent5: The illuded dreamer thought they could fly.
